Join Trajectories

Concatenate any number of trajectories in the specified order.

join(...)

Arguments

...

trajectory objects.

Value

Returns a new trajectory object.

See also

[.trajectory, [[.trajectory, length.trajectory, get_n_activities.

Examples

t1 <- trajectory() %>% seize("dummy", 1)
t2 <- trajectory() %>% timeout(1)
t3 <- trajectory() %>% release("dummy", 1)

join(t1, t2, t3)
#> trajectory: anonymous, 3 activities
#> { Activity: Seize        | resource: dummy, amount: 1 }
#> { Activity: Timeout      | delay: 1 }
#> { Activity: Release      | resource: dummy, amount: 1 }

trajectory() %>%
  join(t1) %>%
  timeout(1) %>%
  join(t3)
#> trajectory: anonymous, 3 activities
#> { Activity: Seize        | resource: dummy, amount: 1 }
#> { Activity: Timeout      | delay: 1 }
#> { Activity: Release      | resource: dummy, amount: 1 }
